intro: Melandrium firmum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy honesty, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white flowers. The leaves are linear and slightly hairy, giving the plant its common name. It produces distinctive, seed-like fruits known as胞果, which are covered in fine hairs. This plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
